cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the north-western Gulf, forecast to bend west and make landfall along the mid-Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Texas coast near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from Louisiana westward to South Texas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with a low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; most winds expected to stay below 34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft and higher than normal tides possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with locally higher totals could trigger ponding and localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along the southeast Louisiana shoreline.
